subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: How GPS Works
description: A fast breakdown of How GPS Works for builders.

hook.text: Your phone knows where you are within 10 feet by listening to 31 satellites orbiting 12,500 miles above Earth.

buildup.text: The US military built GPS during the Cold War. It was made available to civilians in 1983.

discovery.text: Each satellite broadcasts a time signal. Your phone compares signals from four satellites to calculate your position.

twist.text: Until 2000, the military deliberately degraded civilian GPS accuracy. Clinton ordered the scrambling turned off.

climax.text: GPS now underpins banking, farming, aviation, and shipping. A GPS failure would cripple the global economy.

punchline.text: A military weapon became the world's most used tool.

quiz.question: How many satellites does GPS use?
